questions.question: Javascript is an _______ language?
answer: Object-Oriented
Javascript is an Object-Oriented Language.

questions.question: Which of the following keywords is used to define a variable in Javascript?
answer: Both A and B
Both var and let keywords are used to define a variable in Javascript.

questions.question: Which of the following methods is used to access HTML elements using Javascript?
answer: Both A and B
Both the above methods are used to access HTML elements using Javascript.

questions.question: Upon encountering empty statements, what does the Javascript Interpreter do?
answer: Ignores the statements
In Javascript, the interpreter will ignore the empty statements whenever it encounters them.

questions.question: Which of the following methods can be used to display data in some form using Javascript?
answer: All of the above
All of the above methods are used to display data in some form using Javascript.

questions.question: How can a datatype be declared to be a constant type?
answer: const
The const keyword is used to declare a variable as a constant type in Javascript and tells the compiler that its value cannot be changed later in the program.

questions.question: When the switch statement matches the expression with the given labels, how is the comparison done?
choises: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared.
Only the datatype of the expression is compared.
Only the valye of the expression is compared.
answer: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared.
Switch performs an ‘===’ based comparison, i.e both the value of the expression and its datatype is compared.

questions.question: What is the use of the <noscript> tag in Javascript?
choises: The contents are displayed by non-JS-based browsers.
Clears alll the cookies and cache.
answer: The contents are displayed by non-JS-based browsers.
The <noscript> tag is displayed by non-Javascript browsers only.

questions.question: When an operator's value is NULL, the typeof returned by the unary operator is:
answer: Object
Any NULL value of operator will always return typeof object.

questions.question: What does the Javascript “debugger” statement do?
choises: It will debug all the errors in the program at runtime.
It acts as a breakpoint in a program.
It will debug error in the current statement if any.
answer: It acts as a breakpoint in a program.
‘debugger’ statement is used to setup the breakup points at probable points of error in the code snippet, using the debugger window.

questions.question: What does the ‘toLocateString()’ method do in JS?
choises: Returns a localized string representation of an object.
answer: Returns a localized string representation of an object.
The ‘toLocateString()’ method in JS returns a localized string representation of an object.

questions.question: Which of the following are closures in Javascript?
answer: All of the above.
Every time a function is created in JS, a closure is created. So, all closures are functions and functions have a scope chain that is associated with them.

questions.question: What keyword is used to declare an asynchronous function in Javascript?
answer: async
The async keyword is used to declare an asynchronous function in Javascript.

questions.question: How to stop an interval timer in Javascript?
answer: clearInterval
clearInterval is used to stop an interval timer in JS.

questions.question: Which object in Javascript doesn’t have a prototype?
choises: None of the objects have a prototype
answer: Base Object
Base objects are the only objects in Javascript that don’t have a prototype.
